prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2244, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch contains a single face (face_1) which consists of the following loops and curves: - Loop_1: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.3011], End Point [0.2509, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.2509, 0.0], End Point [0.5876, 0.3011] - Line_3: Start Point [0.5876, 0.3011], End Point [0.5876, 0.75] - Line_4: Start Point [0.5876, 0.75], End Point [0.2509, 0.75] - Line_5: Start Point [0.2509, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.5256] - Line_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.5256], End Point [0.0, 0.3011] The 2D sketch should be scaled using the scaling parameter sketch_scale with a value of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal should be 0.2244 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal should be 0. The resulting shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the sides are parallel and meet at right angles, and the object is centered in the image. The length of the object will be 0.75, the width will be 0.2244, and the height will be 0.75.</description>

prompt: <description>**Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The prism has a small opening on the side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. For the sketch, draw a face on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Start by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). Then, draw lines from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.075), (0.75, 0.075) to (0.5665, 0.075), (0.5665, 0.075) to (0.5665, 0.375), (0.5665, 0.375) to (0.4915, 0.375), (0.4915, 0.375) to (0.2644, 0.375), (0.2644, 0.375) to (0.1894, 0.375), (0.1894, 0.375) to (0.1894, 0.075), (0.1894, 0.075) to (0.0, 0.075), (0.0, 0.075) to (0.0, 0.0). These lines form a closed loop, which is the boundary for face 1. Within this loop, there is an arc with a start point at (0.4915, 0.375), a mid point at (0.378, 0.2614), and an end point at (0.2644, 0.375). This arc, along with the lines, forms face 1 of part 1. After sketching, scale the 2D sketch using a scale factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a -90 degrees rotation around the Z-axis and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction to a depth of 0.375 units. Set the sketch scale to 0.75 and perform the "New Body Feature Operation", which creates a new solid body. The resulting shape will have the following dimensions: length = 0.75, width = 0.375, height = 0.75.</description>
